articles.title: DPRK Completes Reprocessing of Spent Fuel Rods
articles.content:
DPRK Completes Reprocessing of Spent Fuel Rods
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Six months have passed since the United States brought up the DPRK's launch of a satellite for peaceful purposes for discussion at the UN Security Council in last April, putting into effect sanctions against it. 
					 In this period, the DPRK restarted the reprocessing facilities and successfully completed the reprocessing of 8,000 spent fuel rods by the end of August as part of the measure taken to restore the nuclear facilities in Nyongbyon to their original state which had been disabled under the agreement reached by the six parties. 
					
					 The DPRK had already clarified that this action taken by the UNSC itself was a wanton infringement upon the sovereignty of the DPRK and a grave insult to the dignity of its people as it legitimately conducted the satellite launch after going through international legal procedures. 
					
					 The DPRK which regards the security of the country and the sovereignty of the nation as its life and soul was compelled to take measures for bolstering up its deterrent for self-defence to cope with the increasing nuclear threat and military provocations of the hostile forces.
					
					 Noticeable successes have been made in turning the extracted plutonium weapon-grade for the purpose of bolstering up the nuclear deterrent in the DPRK.

articles.title: DPRK Contributes to Efforts for Protecting Human Rights
articles.content:
DPRK Contributes to Efforts for Protecting Human Rights
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The DPRK will further consolidate and develop the Korean-style socialist system based on the Juche idea which calls for valuing man as the most precious being and sincerely fulfill its international commitment on the principle of respect for sovereignty and equality and thus make a positive contribution to the world-wide efforts for protecting and promoting human rights. A delegate of the DPRK declared this at the meeting of the Third Committee of the 64th UN General Assembly held on October 28.
					 The DPRK government regards it as the supreme principle of state activities to protect and promote human rights and improve the people's well-being, he noted, and continued:
					
					 Human rights are firmly guaranteed legally and substantially as inviolable sacred rights and everyone fully enjoys human rights and basic freedom related to his or her dignity. 
					
					 He called for properly settling the human rights abuses committed in the past.
					
					  In recent years some countries have taken positive steps to make an apology and reparation for the human rights abuses committed by them in other countries during their colonial rules.
					
					 However, Japan has so far evaded its governmental responsibility for such hideous crimes against humanity committed during its past military occupation of Korea as the massacre of more than one million Koreans, conscription of at least 8.4 million Koreans and the act of forcing more than 200,000 Korean women into sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army and refused to make an apology and reparation to the victims and made no scruple of distorting the crime-woven history though a century has passed since then.
					
					 Proceeding from this viewpoint, the Japanese authorities have perpetrated all sorts of discriminations and human rights abuses against Korean residents in Japan.
					
					 Japan would be well advised to behave with discretion, mindful that its future depends on making a sincere apology and reparation for its past crimes.

articles.title: 40th Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Work Marked
articles.content:
40th Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Work Marked
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held at the Central Hall of Workers Tuesday to mark President Kim Il Sung's work "Let Us Develop Physical Culture and Sports on a Mass Basis and Prepare All the People for Labor and Defence."
					 Kim Il Sung provided the national meeting of sportsmen on November 4, Juche 58 (1969) and published the work. The work comprehensively elucidates the significance and importance of physical culture and sports in the revolution and construction and the orientation of developing them on a new high stage as required by the developing reality and ways to do so.  
					
					 Present at the meeting were Kim Jung Rin, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kwak Pom Gi, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Pak Hak Son, chairman of the Korean Physical Culture and Sports Guidance Commission, officials concerned and sportsmen and working people in Pyongyang. 
					
					 Kwak Pom Gi, addressing the meeting, said that the work regards the development of physical culture and sports as important component of cultural revolution and gives a scientific answer to the theoretical and practical issues arising in developing it into an all-people movement. The work serves as a great programme of building socialist physical culture and sports consistent with the Juche-oriented principle and method and guidelines to be constantly adhered to, he added, and continued:
					
					 The history of Juche-oriented physical culture and sports of the DPRK is more brilliantly shining under the experienced and seasoned leadership of Kim Jong Il. He has led the Juche-based physical culture and sports to making ceaseless leaping progress on the principle of thoroughly defending, embodying and developing the President's idea and exploits on sports.
					
					 Thanks to the energetic guidance and warm loving care of Kim Jong Il the ranks of sportsmen have grown stronger and the country's sports technology has been put on a higher stage, achieving brilliant successes at many international games. 
					
					 Colorful sports activities have been widely organized according to the WPK's unique policy of popular physical culture and sports and movement for creating a model sports unit has been briskly conducted. As a result, the revolutionary optimism and emotion pervade the whole country, and all the people are reliably prepared for labor and defense.

articles.title: Inter-Korean Meeting Marks Centenary of Martyr's Patriotic Deed
articles.content:
Inter-Korean Meeting Marks Centenary of Martyr's Patriotic Deed
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- An inter-Korean meeting was held in Kaesong on Nov. 3 to mark the lapse of 100 years since the patriotic deed done by martyr An Jung Gun.
					 Attending it were Jang Jae On, chairman of the Religious Believers Council of Korea, Jong Tok Gi, vice-chairman of the National Reconciliation Council, and other officials concerned from the north side and Chairman of the board Ham Se Ung and other members of the Memorial Commission for Martyr An Jung Gun and Jo Kwang, director of the An Jung Gun Institute from the south side.
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to the memory of An Jung Gun.
					
					 Addresses were made at the meeting before there were speeches on the theme of "The patriotic deed of martyr An Jung Gun and our task".
					
					 Recalling that An shot Hirobumi Ito to death on Oct. 26, 100 years ago, the speakers stressed that it was a punishment of the Japanese imperialist aggressors by justice and a patriotic deed that demonstrated the Korean nation's will never to remain a colonial slave of the foreign forces.
					
					 The patriotic soul of the martyr calls upon the Koreans to put an end to the foreign forces' domination and interference and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification, they said.
					
					 They recalled that the "period of anti-Japanese joint struggle in memory of martyr An Jung Gun" was set from Oct. 26 this year to March 26, 2010, the centenary of his demise, to vigorously wage the mass movement.
					
					 They urged all Koreans to turn out in the struggle to adhere to and implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration under the banner of "By our nation itself".
					
					 Read out at the meeting was the appeal to all Koreans already adopted and made public in the joint name of the Religious Believers Council of Korea and the Memorial Commission for Martyr An Jung Gun.
					
					 Prior to the meeting, its participants looked round the photos showing An Jung Gun and his relics and exposing the atrocities of the Japanese imperialists and reinvasion moves, presented by the north and the south.

articles.title: Cuban Embassies Help Korean Farmers
articles.content:
Cuban Embassies Help Korean Farmers
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Jose Manuel Galego Montano, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy did a friendship work at the DPRK-Cuba Friendship Hwasong Co-op Farm in Ryongsong District, Pyongyang, Tuesday.
					 They helped farmers in threshing rice. 
					
					 The ambassador referred to the fact that the friendly relations between the DPRK and Cuba provided by President Kim Il Sung and Fidel Castro Ruz continue favorably developing under the deep care of General Secretary Kim Jong Il and Raul Castro Ruz.
					
					 He wished the agricultural workers of the farm now waging the dynamic 100-day campaign great success in agricultural production.

articles.title: 5th Exhibition of Univ. Scientific Research Successes Held
articles.content:
5th Exhibition of Univ. Scientific Research Successes Held 
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The 5th national exhibition of university scientific research successes was held at the Three-Revolution Exhibition from Oct. 27 to Nov. 3.
					 On display at the exhibition were more than 1,400 scientific and technological research successes made recently to contribute to putting science and technology in various fields of the national economy including the metal, electricity and coal industries and railway transport on a higher stage and improving the standard of people's living. 
					
					 The exhibition was divided into 20 panels including metal industry, information, biology, agriculture, light industry, machine building, electronics and medical science. They offered opportunities to exchange the scientific and technological successes achieved in putting the production and management on a modern and IT basis.
					
					 Ultra-modern scientific and technological successes helpful to developing IT and Nano technology and bio-engineering drew the attention of the participants.
					
					 Its closing ceremony was held on Tuesday.

articles.title: Signal Successes Made in Production of Mineral Ores
articles.content:
Signal Successes Made in Production of Mineral Ores
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The workers in the field of the mining industry are making leaping progress through a high-pitched 100-day campaign, holding high the torch of a new great revolutionary surge. 
					 Steady achievements have been made in the production of various kinds of minerals and concentrated ores at a time when an all-out charge is under way to glorify this year as a year bringing about a land-mark turn in the building of a thriving nation. 
					
					 Officials and workers of the Jaeryong Mine and the Unryul Mine produced large quantities of iron ore outside their plans in October by displaying the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance and fortitude and sent them to iron and steel works. 
					
					 The mines under the Tanchon Area Mining General Bureau are reporting signal successes through a dynamic 100-day campaign. 
					
					 The workers of the Komdok Mining Complex, the Taehung Youth Hero Mine and the Ryongyang Mine have brought about innovations in the production. 
					
					 The production of non-ferrous metal ores, magnesium ore and magnesia clinker swelled in October thanks to their devoted drive.  Feats are also reported from the uranium ore mines in different parts of the country.
					
					 Signal achievements have been made in the production of uranium ore thanks to the high zeal and strenuous labor drive of the officials and workers to satisfactorily provide nuclear fuel to the LWR power plant to be built by the DPRK itself in the future. 
					
					 The workers in the field of mining industry are waging an uninterrupted dynamic drive to contribute to the building of a thriving nation with greater successes in the production of mineral ores true to the  Songun leadership of the Workers’ Party of Korea.

articles.title: New Books Published
articles.content:
New Books Published
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Publishing House has recently brought out new books.
					 The book "Anecdotes about Great Man Reflected in Popular Policies" carries some of many anecdotes about President Kim Il Sung which were created when he instituted policies for the happiness of the people, covering the road of on-the-spot guidance in his life time. 
					
					 The book consists of three chapters--1. Establishment of Most Superior Educational System, 2. Story about Popular Health System and 3. Providing Home for Happiness.
					
					 Another book is the collection of memoirs "My Life, My Motherland" written by Son Song Mo, an indomitable patriot for reunification. It writes about his life in the bosom of the DPRK and the struggle for defending it.

articles.title: Sports Persons Commended
articles.content:
Sports Persons Commended
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Male footballers, coaches and officials were officially commended with due ceremony on Monday in recognition of their meritorious services rendered for obtaining the qualification to participate in the 2010 World Cup.  
					 A watch bearing the august name of President Kim Il Sung was awarded to Kim Jong Sik, deputy director of a department of the Korean Physical Culture and Sports Guidance Commission, and a citation of  General Secretary Kim Jong Il to Kim Jong Su, director of a department of the commission. 
					
					 The title of People's Sportsman went to Chief Coach Kim Jong Hun and 15 others and the title of Merited Sportsman to player Ji Yun Nam and two others.
					
					 The Order of National Flag first class was conferred upon a person and the same order second class upon eight persons. Orders and medals also went to many other players and officials.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries' Visits to "Yasukuni Shrine" Blasted
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries' Visits to "Yasukuni Shrine" Blasted
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, a group of riff-raffs including former Japanese Prime Minister Aso visited "Yasukuni Shrine" to pray for the souls of those killed while earning ill-fame in the past wars of aggression on the occasion of the "autumn festival."
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' group visit to "Yasukuni Shrine" is a mockery of human conscience and insult to the peoples who suffered from the wars ignited by Japan.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 Lurking behind this is a dangerous intention to create a social atmosphere for reinvasion by denying and distorting Japan's past history of aggression and painting it as a "just one".
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are keeping on the shrine remains and name tablets of those killed in the past wars of aggression in a bid to "sanctify" them and convince the people that the war criminals met heroic deaths while doing something good in the past. It is clear that if Japanese are imbued with this idea, they are bound to harbor an extremely dangerous idea of defending and reviving Japan's past history of aggression, instead of feeling guilty conscience of it. If this tendency is fostered, youngsters of Japan will tend to interpret overseas aggression as "a sacred act" and go so reckless as to play a role in similar wars.
					
					 The racket of visit to "Yasukuni Shrine" kicked off by the Japanese reactionaries in Japan would lead to speeding up the moves to convert it into a military power guided by the militarist idea and   establish a wartime system and intensifying the provocative exercises for a war of aggression. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are going reckless in their moves to spark a military conflict against the DPRK, while stoking bitterness towards the DPRK among Japanese under the pretext of non-existent "military threat" from it.
					
					 The claim to Tok Islet, the call for tightened sanctions against the DPRK and outbursts asserting preemptive attacks on it, etc. are nothing but a revelation of the Japanese militarist forces' hysteria of reinvasion of Korea that has gone beyond the danger line, the commentary notes, urging the Japanese reactionaries to face up to the trend of the times and halt their reckless militarist moves.

articles.title: U.S. Accused of Working Hard for Military Alliance with Japan and S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. Accused of Working Hard for Military Alliance with Japan and S. Korea
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- U.S. Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs Campbell at a recent Congressional confirmation hearing stressed the need for the U.S. to reinforce the military alliance with Japan and south Korea. Meanwhile, the Center for New American Security in its recent report called for adopting the U.S. security commitment to Northeast Asia as a mid-term and long-term security policy. Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a signed commentary carried in this regard:
					 The U.S. is hell bent on reinforcing the military alliance with Japan and south Korea, labeling the DPRK "an unstable factor," but this is nothing but sophism to cover up the criminal nature of its Asia strategy for domination.
					
					 The U.S. revealed its scenario to militarily stifle the DPRK by putting forward Japan and south Korea as its shock brigade. This is a very reckless action of driving the situation on the Korean Peninsula to an extreme phase. 
					
					 The U.S. is pursuing a strategy to establish domination over the Korean Peninsula by using the twin swords called the U.S.-Japan alliance and the U.S.-south Korea alliance in East Asia in the main. Prompted by this, the U.S. has long maintained the military alliance with Japan and south Korea and steadily bolstered the combined operation capability for mounting a preemptive attack on the DPRK through such various military actions as the introduction of war supplies, joint military exercises and troop reinforcement.
					
					 The U.S. does not hide its great uneasiness about the daily growing political and military potentials of the DPRK and the sign shown by the new Japanese regime to make a series of modifications of its U.S. toeing policy.
					
					 That is why the U.S. is busy vociferating about the provision of "extended deterrent" and reiterating its commitment to bolster the alliance, while urging its “allies” to remain true to its Asia strategy free from the worry about their “security” with the assurance that it would be protected by Washington. 
					
					 The U.S. and its “allies” had better cogitate, mindful of the grave consequences to be entailed by their reckless military actions.

articles.title: Padded C lothes Associated with Warm Love for Peasants
articles.content:
Padded Clothes Associated with Warm Love for Peasants
						
Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited an exhibition hall to look samples of padded clothes for peasants in September Juche 68 (1979).
					 A meeting of the Political Committee of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (then), which was held in the presence of President Kim Il Sung some days before, discussed and decided an issue of providing agricultural working people throughout the country with padded clothes free of charge on the occasion of the new year.
					
					Kim Jong Il already assigned officials concerned to a task to make samples of padded clothes beforehand, indicating them the way of finishing its production in time while ensuring its quality. That day he went out to the hall to see the samples.
					
					 At the exhibition hall, he asked officials whether they had consulted with peasants about the types of the clothes.
					
					At the moment, they were dumbfounded because they designed them without discussion.
					
					 He said to the following effect: As for the cloth, the young and old men demand different kinds of cloth. They will therefore demand different types of clothes. You should fix the types of dresses in accordance with the opinion of the peasants.
					
					 And he added that as the peasants demanded thick padded clothes, more cotton should be padded.
					
					 Saying that as they always worked outside, they would feel draught through sleeves, he emphasized that windbreak sleeves should be attached to the clothes.
					
					 Under his warm care, the agricultural working people were provided with padded clothes suiting to their tastes on the occasion of the new year 1980.

articles.title: RPDC contribuira activamente a la defensa de DDHH
articles.content:
RPDC contribuira activamente a la defensa de DDHH
Pyongyang, 3 de noviembre (ATCC) -- La Republica Popular Democratica de Corea contribuira activamente a los esfuerzos mundiales por defender y fomentar los derechos humanos de los pueblos al consolidar el regimen socialista coreano basado en la idea Juche, que aprecia mas al hombre, y cumplir con fidelidad su deber internacional en el principio de respeto a la soberania y la igualdad.
					  Dijo asi el 28 de octubre el delegado coreano al hacer uso de la palabra en el tercer comite del 64o periodo de sesiones de la Asamblea General de la ONU y continuo:
					
					  El gobierno de la RPDC toma como el principio supremo de las actividades estatales proteger y fomentar los derechos humanos y mejorar el bienestar del pueblo.
					
					En la RPDC los DDHH resultan los sagrados e inviolables y estan garantizados firmemente en lo juridico y practico y todos disfrutan suficientemente de los derechos humanos y la libertad fundamental correspondientes a su dignidad.
					
					  Aprovechando esta ocasion, insisto en la solucion correcta del problema de violacion de DDHH en el pasado.
					
					  En los ultimos anos, algunos paises toman las medidas positivas de pedir disculpas e indemnizar los actos de violacion de derechos humanos perpetrados en sus ex colonias.
					
					  En el pasado, durante la ocupacion militar sobre Corea, los imperialistas japoneses asesinaron a mas de un millon de coreanos, arrestaron forzosamente a mas de 8 millones 400 mil y sometieron a 200 mil coreanas al sistema de esclavitud sexual por concepto de "consoladoras" de las tropas japonesas.
					
					  A pesar de estos crimenes de lesa humanidad de gran envergadura, Japon elude hasta en el nuevo siglo la responsabilidad gubernamental por el respecto, rehusa disculparse e indemnizar a las victimas y no vacila para colmo en cometer la locura de tergiversar su historia criminal. 
					
					  Desde tal punto de vista, las autoridades japonesas no cesan de cometer hasta la fecha los actos de discriminacion y violacion de DDHH de todo tipo contra los coreanos residentes en Japon.
					
					  El pais isleno debe actuar teniendo presente que su futuro esta en disculparse e indemnizar sinceramente por sus crimenes del pasado.

articles.title: Tiene lugar acto por 40o aniversario de obra de Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Tiene lugar acto por 40o aniversario de obra de Kim Il Sung
Pyongyang, 3 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Se celebro este martes en la Casa Central de los Obreros un acto dedicado al cuadragesimo aniversario de la publicacion de la obra del Presidente Kim Il Sung "Mediante la popularizacion del deporte preparemos vigorosamente a todo el pueblo para el trabajo y la defensa nacional".
					  Esta obra fue publicada en la Conferencia Nacional de Deportistas sesionada el 4 de noviembre del 58 (1969) de la Era Juche gracias al Presidente.
					
					  En ella estan senalados la importancia del deporte en la revolucion y la construccion, el rumbo y remedios para desarrollarlo en la nueva etapa mas alta conforme a la demanda de la realidad en desarrollo.
					
					  En el acto participaron el secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Jung Rin, el vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros Kwak Pom Gi, el presidente del Comite de Direccion de Deportes, Pak Hak Son, y otros funcionarios, asi como los deportistas y trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					  El informante Kwak Pom Gi senalo ante todo que la obra del Presidente dio la respuesta cientifica a los problemas teoricos y practicos que se presentan en desarrollar el deporte como movimiento de todo el pueblo considerandolo como importante componente de la revolucion cultural.
					
					  Por lo tanto, ella deviene el gran programa de la construccion del deporte socialista, penetrado de los autoctonos principios y metodos, y la guia directriz a que debemos atenernos siempre, apunto.
					
					  La historia del autoctono deporte de nuestro pais adquiere mayor esplendor bajo la probada y diestra guia del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, indico y se refirio a que la direccion de este permite lograr incesantes saltos en la rama en el principio de defender, materializar y desarrollar la idea y las hazanas del Presidente vinculadas con el deporte.
					
					  Bajo la dinamica direccion y atencion afectuosa del Dirigente, se formaron muchos deportistas competentes, se elevaron a la etapa mas alta las tecnologias deportivas nacionales y se lograron exitos orgullosos en numerosos eventos internacionales, menciono.
					
					  En virtud de la original politica del PTC sobre el deporte masificado, se organizaron ampliamente diversas actividades deportivas y se dinamizo el movimiento por la creacion de las unidades ejemplares en el deporte, comento.
					
					  De esta manera, en todo el pais reina el optimismo revolucionario y todos se preparan fidedignamente para el trabajo y la defensa nacional, concluyo.

articles.title: Acto conjunto Norte-Sur en memoria de An Jung Gun
articles.content:
Acto conjunto Norte-Sur en memoria de An Jung Gun
Pyongyang, 3 de noviembre (ATCC) --   Tuvo lugar el dia 3 en Kaesong el acto conjunto Norte-Sur de Corea en ocasion del centesimo aniversario de la accion patriotica del martir An Jung Gun.
					  En la ocasion participaron por la parte Norte el presidente del Consejo Ecumenico de Corea (CEC), Jang Jae On, el vicepresidente del Consejo por la Reconciliacion Nacional, Jong Tok Gi, y otros funcionarios, y por la parte Sur, los miembros de la "Comision Memorial para el Martir An Jung Gun" incluyendo el presidente Ham Se Ung y el presidente del "Instituto de An Jung Gun", Jo Kwang.
					
					  Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria del martir An.
					
					  En la ocasion hubo discursos seguidos de intervenciones bajo el titulo de "La accion patriotica del martir An Jung Gun y nuestra tarea".
					
					  Los oradores recordaron que el 26 de octubre de hace ahora 100 anos, An Jung Gun ejecuto a tiros a Ito Hirobumi.
					
					Continuaron que ese incidente fue el castigo justo a los agresores japoneses y la accion patriotica que mostro que la nacion coreana no desea jamas vivir como esclavos coloniales.
					
					  Senalaron que el alma patriotica del martir An llama hoy a todos los coreanos a la lucha por alcanzar la reunificacion independiente y pacifica acabando con el dominio y la intervencion de las fuerzas foraneas.
					
					  Expresaron la voluntad de desarrollar con valentia el movimiento masivo fijando como "periodo de lucha conjunta antijaponesa en memoria del martir An Jung Gun" desde el 26 de octubre de este ano hasta el 26 de marzo de 2010 en que se cumplira el centesimo aniversario del fallecimiento del martir.
					
					  Enfatizaron que todos los coreanos deben levantarse en la lucha por defender y poner en practica la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre bajo la bandera del ideal "Entre nosotros, los connacionales".
					
					  En la ocasion se dio lectura al llamamiento a toda la nacion aprobado y publicado ya en nombre comun del Consejo Ecumenico de Corea (CEC) y la "Comision Memorial para el Martir An Jung Gun".
					
					  Con anterioridad, los participantes vieron las fotos alusivas al martir An Jung Gun y sus pertenencias y las otras que revelan las atrocidades de los imperialistas japoneses y sus maniobras para la nueva agresion, las cuales fueron exhibidas por el Norte y el Sur.

articles.title: Termina en la RPDC retratamiento de barras usadas de combustible
articles.content:
Termina en la RPDC retratamiento de barras usadas de combustible
Pyongyang, 3 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Transcurrieron 6 meses desde abril pasado cuando Estados Unidos activo la sancion contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea cuestionando en el Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU el lanzamiento de satelite artificial, ejecutado por la segunda con fines pacificos.
					Durante ese plazo, como parte de las medidas para reconstruir en su estado original las instalaciones nucleares de Nyongbyon que habian sido neutralizadas segun el acuerdo logrado en las conversaciones a 6 bandas, se puso en funcionamiento la instalacion para el tratamiento de las cenizas y termino con exito hasta finales de agosto esta labor sobre 8 mil barras usadas de combustible.
					
					La RPDC ya ha aclarado que resulta flagrante violacion a la soberania de si misma y grave insulto a la dignidad del pueblo coreano el mismo hecho de que el Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU haya planteado y discutido el lanzamiento de satelite artificial de Corea efectuado justamente pasando por los tramites requeridos por la ley internacional.
					
					La RPDC, que aprecia como su vida la seguridad del pais y la soberania de la nacion, se vio obligada a optar por fortalecer su disuasivo para la autodefensa frente a la creciente amenaza nuclear y la provocacion militar de las fuerzas hostiles.
					
					Se lograron notables exitos en usar en armas el plutonio extraido con el proposito de incrementar el disuasivo nuclear de Corea.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia la visita al "Santuario Yasukuni"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia la visita al "Santuario Yasukuni"
Pyongyang, 3 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Hace poco, con motivo del "gran ritual otonal", el ex premier japones Aso y otros fulanos y menganos oraron en el "Santuario Yasukuni" por los connotados criminales que murieron en las guerras de agresion del siglo pasado.
					La visita de los reaccionarios japoneses a ese lugar deviene una burla a la conciencia de la humanidad y un insulto a los pueblos de los paises victimas de la guerra.
					
					Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual difundido este martes y continua:
					
					Detras de esa marana esta el peligroso intento de negar y tergiversar su historia de agresion del pasado, describirla como la "justa" y crear el ambiente social favorable a la nueva agresion.
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses conservan en ese santuario las tablillas y listas de los muertos en las guerras de agresion del pasado para "rendirles el culto", de modo que los habitantes piensen que los criminales de guerra "murieron honrosamente mientras realizaban trabajos utiles". 
					
					Es natural que si el pueblo japones toma tal conciencia, no se sienta culpable de su historia de agresiones del pasado y cultive la peligrosa idea de defenderla y repetirla. 
					
					A la larga, las nuevas generaciones de Japon consideraran la agresion a ultramar como "accion sagrada" y abrigaran la loca ilusion de jugar importante papel en ese crimen.
					
					A medida que se tornan mas frecuentes las visitas de los reaccionarios japoneses al "Santuario Yasukuni", se aceleran en Japon la conversion en una potencia militar y el paso al sistema para el tiempo de guerra, basados en la idea militarista, y se despliegan freneticamente las maniobras belicas para la agresion con denso olor a la polvora.
					
					Ellos hablan de la inexistente "amenaza militar" de la RPDC para inculcar en los habitantes japoneses la conciencia hostil  a la RPDC y actuan con frenesi para provocar el conflicto militar contra ella.
					
					La insistencia en el "derecho de posesion" del islote Tok, la perversa campana de sancion contra la RPDC, el disparate de ataque preventivo y otros son la manifestacion de las desenfrenadas y alarmantes pretensiones de las fuerzas militaristas japonesas de agredir de nuevo a Corea. 
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses deben poner fin a su alboroto militarista justipreciando la corriente de la epoca.
